abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was unsatisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            negligible, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            unsatisfactory,. The lessons learned indicate that the Bank
            needs to improve its monitoring and course correcting during
            implementation and this process begins with a clear and
            unambiguous statement of project objectives. Project
            objectives need to be clearly defined to enable the borrower
            and the Bank to supervise the project. Bank teams should
            address all major issues highlighted in these reports and
            justify to the management one way or another on all major
            concerns. It is important to set up a good system of M&E
            for a project. It is even more essential to help a client
            build an M&E system which can be sustainable after the
            project closes. The Bank needs to review and assess all of
            the components which contribute to development objectives,
            including the ones that are not financed by the Bank.
            Triggers should be policy-oriented and results-focused. The
            Bank and the borrower should agree on the outcomes and the
            monitorable performance measures for Information and
            Communication Technology (ICT) investments. It is important
            to assess the institutional capacity of the implementation
            agency during preparation of the project, and make
            arrangements to ensure the management structure would meet
            the demand of the project implementation. Milestones and
            targets for implementation need to be agreed and strictly
            followed by the borrower and the Bank. Realistic risk
            assessment in project design and measures to mitigate them
            are essential. Lessons from APL1 were not assessed in time
            in order to incorporate them during the preparation of the
            APL2. This has led to deficiencies in the design of APL2.
